ffi-engine-logo-indicator-alt-text: Alt-text of the logo indicator shown on pages in the Script namespace.
ffi-error-category:
{{tracking category name}}
Tracking category for pages with errors from #script.
ffi-error-category-desc: Description on [[Special:TrackingCategories]] for the {{msg-mw|ffi-error-category}} tracking category.
ffi-invalid-engine-specification-error:
Error message displayed when trying to construct an engine from an invalid engine specification. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the engine that the application tried to construct
* $2 - the reason for why the specification is invalid
ffi-invalid-engine-specification-reason-: Reason displayed when an engine specification is invalid because of a missing attribute. Used as $2 in {{msg-mw|ffi-invalid-engine-specification-exception}}. Parameters: * $1 - the name of the attribute that is missing

Reason displayed when an engine specification is invalid because of the specified class does not exist. Used as $2 in {{msg-mw|ffi-invalid-engine-specification-exception}}. Parameters: * $1 - the name of the class that does not exist
ffi-missing-engine-error:
Error message displayed when the user tries to invoke a script for which no engine has been configured. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the script the user tried to invoke
ffi-missing-engine-indicator: Indicator shown when no engine is available for the script.
ffi-missing-function-name-error: Error message displayed when the user tries to invoke a script without specifying which function to invoke.
ffi-no-engine-error: Error message displayed at the top of the edit form when the user tries to save a script without a valid engine configured for the script's file extension.
ffi-no-such-engine-error:
Error message displayed when trying to construct an engine that does not exist. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the engine that the application tried to construct
ffi-no-such-script-error:
Error message displayed when the user tries to invoke a script that does not exist. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the script the user tried to invoke
ffi-script-error-prefix: Prefix appended to error messages displayed when the invocation of a script using the '#script' parser function fails.
